entry.summary: Sim: FS24. iniBuilds recently issued another update to their A350 Airliner for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, improving core areas, fixing bugs, and adding larger new items. The VNAV system underwent a major overhaul, with improvements to vertical profile adherence and constraint handling, as well as the addition of Constant Mach Segments, Continuous Descent Approach, and Estimated Take-off Time.Â Furthermore, iniBuilds has also added dynamic icing and snow effects, GSX integration for de-icing, and hot brake disc visuals on both platforms.Â The ECAM system also expanded with new fuel, icing, braking, and thrust logic alerts. They have also done audio work to refine the cabin ambience, engine dynamics, and touchdown feedback, aiming to close the gap between their virtual rendition and the real thing. Optimization work was carried out under the hood to warrant better performance, with code cleanups and restructuring reducing the overhead and thus improving the framerate.Â The complete changelog for entry.title: flyt Releases Afonso Pena International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. flyt has recently released their rendition of Afonso Pena International Airport (SBCT) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, serving Curitiba, Brazil, with a yearly average of 5.1 million passengers. It was built by the Brazilian Air Force Ministry in partnership with the United States Army during World War 2, although it never really served its âwartime purposeâ because it was completed only in 1945, as the lights were already going out on the battlefield.Â Within a year of its completion, the airport was dedicated as a civil airport, which it has consistently been. The first passenger terminal remained in use until 1959, when a replacement one was built. It remained in use for nearly 40 years, until it was replaced by a much larger one in 1996. The old terminal was then converted into a cargo terminal. The airport was upgraded in 2009 during the governmentâs effort to bring all the major airports up to modern standards for the World Cup (2014). The government spent 30 million BRL on enlarged aprons, new taxiways, and better parking infrastructure. Itâs a focus city for Azul, and served by AerolÃ­neas Argentinas, Gol Linhas AÃ©reas, JetSmart Chile, LATAM Brazil, LATAM Chile, and LATAM Peru. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with custom ground textures, custom jetways, custom terminal interior, custom ground service equipment, an up-to-date ground layout, and much more. entry.title: iBlueYonder Publishes Trailer for Upcoming Dallas Love Field for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. iBlueYonder has recently published a trailer for their upcoming Dallas Love Field (KDAL) for X-Plane 12, developed in partnership with StableSystem and joshomoore (they handled the porting process, as the scenery was originally made for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020). Dallas Love Field is the 31st busiest airport in the United States, with a yearly average of 6 million passengers, opened 105 years ago as a training camp for WW1 pilots and then converted into a storage facility for surplus aircraft right after the war, where it barely saw any action for nearly ten years. It was then purchased by the city of Dallas in 1928 and opened for civilian use, with the first set of paved runways to come four years later.Â The first proper terminal was built in 1940, serving 21 weekday airline departures from American, Braniff, and Delta.Â World War 2 forced the airport to return to its training school roots, only ceasing after it was all over when it once again returned to being a civil airport.Â With the increased passenger numbers during the late 1950s came the need for a new terminal (T3) designed by Donald S. Nelson. It would have three concourses, 26 gates, and the worldâs first moving walkways.Â Nowadays, the airport has a single terminal with 20 gates, with Alaska and Delta Air Lines having one each, and the remaining 18 are under Southwestâs helm. Not coincidentally, Southwest Airlines has 95.3% of the passenger market share, followed by Delta with 2.2% and Alaska with 1.7%. Houston (387,000), Denver (367,000), and Atlanta (358,000) compose the top list of busiest destinations from Love Field. While an official feature list hasnât been revealed yet, its ported nature probably means it wonât differ much from the original, which features custom ground textures, a high-detail terminal model with its interior, hand-crafted and hand-placed signage, custom night lighting, and more. Thereâs yet to be any information on pricing or a release date, but Threshold will keep you informed! If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon! â

entry.title: KiwiFlightSim Releases Faleolo International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. KiwiFlightSim has recently released their rendition of Faleolo International Airport (NSFA) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024, serving Apia, in Samoa. The United States Navy built it in the 1940s on land reclaimed by the New Zealand colonial administration as an airfield and naval base. The original runway was only 1,200 meters long, but it eventually expanded to 1,829 meters in 1943 to accommodate larger fighter jets. After the war, the airport became relatively underutilized, only seeing proper traffic after an upgrade in 1957 that allowed the conversion from seaplanes to land-based aircraft. An upgrade followed in the 1970s to create a 1,700-meter-long sealed runway less vulnerable to floods (common in the region). The new addition would allow larger jets like the Boeing 737 to fly into the airport. Further upgrades followed in the mid-1980s and early 2000s to make it able to handle even larger jet aircraft. Air New Zealand, Fiji Airways, Qantas, Samoa Airways, Talofa Airways, and Virgin Australia serve it. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with a 3D modeled main terminal and its interior (plus VIP terminal, regional terminal, and tower, all with their respective interiors), custom night lighting, custom ground textures, custom jetways, custom GSX profile, and much more. Itâs available on SimMarket for roughly $15.33, requiring at least 1.39 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: SoFly Releases Hannover Airport for MSFS 20/24
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. SoFly has released its highly anticipated version of Hannover Airport (EDDV) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The international airport serves over 5 million passengers annually, making it the ninth-largest airport in Germany. Hannover Airport opened its doors in 1952. In 1973, it expanded with the introduction of two modern passenger terminals, A and B, which are still in operation today. The final terminal, C, was inaugurated in 1998. In the year 2000, the airport was connected by rail to the town of Hamelin through Hannover, and Paderborn was linked by rail a few years later in 2003. Today, Hannover Airport serves as a focus city for several airlines, including Corendon Airlines Europe, Eurowings, and TUI fly Deutschland. With a range of other airlines operating, the airport offers destinations across Europe, accommodating over 5 million passengers each year. The scenery comes packed with features such as interactive scenery technology, dynamic airport environment, moving ground transport, interior modelling, high-resolution texturing and modelling, and so much more. The newly released Hannover Airport is now available directly from SoFly for approximately $25.22. â For the latest flight simulation news, remember to stay tuned on Threshold! â If you enjoy our content and want to support Threshold, consider joining us on Patreon!

entry.title: iBlueYonder Releases Dallas Love Field for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Developer iBlueYonder has released its latest scenery for X-Plane 12: Dallas Love Field (KDAL). Situated just over 5 nautical miles from downtown Dallas, this Texan airport accommodates more than 16 million passengers annually. Opened in 1917, the airport initially served as a training base for the U.S. Army Air Service during World War I. Following the war, it continued as a military air base until the City of Dallas purchased it in 1927, marking the beginning of civilian operations, with commercial flights starting shortly thereafter. During World War II, the airport was again utilized by the military. After the war, commercial traffic at the airport saw significant growth. Over the years, the airport has undergone various expansions and improvements. Today, it operates as a base for Southwest Airlines and JSX while also serving Delta Airlines. These airlines facilitate nearly 250,000 aircraft operations each year, handling over 16 million passengers. The scenery includes features such as a complete representation of the airport, a skyline of Dallas City, a detailed terminal interior, custom night lighting, hand-placed vegetation, and more. entry.title: Verticalsim Releases Southwest Florida International Airport for MSFS 2020/2024
entry.summary: Sim: FS24. Verticalsim has recently released their rendition of Southwest Florida International Airport (KRSW) for Microsoft Flight Simulator 2020 and 2024. The airport serves Fort Myers and Southwest Florida and has a yearly average of 11 million passengers. RSW was built to replace Fort Myers' former main airport, Page Field, as it was considered too small and difficult to expand due to certain constraints (like a major highway, for example), starting anew elsewhere seemed the better idea. Construction started in 1980, and the airport was inaugurated on schedule three years later. It featured an 8400-foot runway and a terminal with 14 gates on two concourses. In 1993, a 50,000-square-foot Federal Inspection facility was annexed to the main concourse, and the runway was lengthened to 12,000 feet to better accommodate international service. The terminal underwent expansion in 1998 to keep up with the region's ever-growing demand for air travel. A new wing and three additional gates were added to Concourse B. An entirely new terminal project, with three concourses and 28 gates, started in 2002. Part of the original terminal had to be demolished to make room for the new one. It's an operating base for Breeze Airways, and served by Air Canada Rouge, Alaska Airlines, American Airlines, Avelo Airlines, Delta Air Lines, Discover Airlines, Frontier Airlines, JetBlue, Porter Airlines, Southwest Airlines, Spirit Airlines, Sun Country Airlines, United Airlines, and WestJet. The scenery features an accurate rendition of the airport, with an up-to-date ground layout, custom ground textures, performance-friendly optimization, an official GSX profile, custom high-grade aerial imagery, basic interiors for performance, and much more. It's available on Contrail for roughly $18.00, requiring at least 3.82 GB of free hard disk space to install. entry.title: Just Flight Releases 146 Professional for X-Plane 12
entry.summary: Sim: X-Plane. Just Flight, in a partnership with Thranda Design, has released 146 Professional for X-Plane 12. Based on BAe 146, its rendition features eight variants:Â 146-100/-200/-300, 146-200QC/QT (QC - Quick change, QT - Quiet Trader), 146-300QT, as well as CC.Mk2 and CC.Mk3 (RAF VIP and cargo configurations, respectively). The BAe 146 is a short-haul regional airliner produced by British Aerospace between 1983 and 1994, when its improved version, named Avro RJ, replaced it. 221 146s were made, with the -200 variant being the most popular one, with 116 of them built.
